text.section: As to a complaint retained by the Ethics Commission under § 15-402(b) of this subtitle, the staff counsel shall collect and refer to the Ethics Commission evidence relating to each violation of this title alleged in the complaint.

section.section: Prior to submitting the evidence to the Ethics Commission, the staff counsel shall notify the complainant and the respondent.

The Commission shall dismiss the complaint in a signed order if:
the respondent, within 15 days after receiving the notice, takes any action that may be available to cure each alleged violation; and
it finds that dismissal is not contrary to the purposes of this title.
If the complaint is dismissed under this subsection, the Ethics Commission shall promptly send a copy of the order to the complainant and the respondent.

text.section:
If the Ethics Commission determines that the evidence submitted by the staff counsel does not merit further proceedings, the Ethics Commission shall:
dismiss the complaint in a signed order; and
promptly send a copy of the order to the complainant and the respondent.
If a complaint is not dismissed under subsection (b) or (c) of this section, the Ethics Commission shall proceed to a hearing on the complaint.
